title: cryptosk04
author: cryptosk04
content: I recently came across a way to get free cryptocurrencies, which is through crypto faucets. I'm not that mature in the crypto world but want to own some crypto and start my journey in this space. After so much research, I got to know that there are many websites called crypto faucets which reward users with crypto for performing several tasks on their platform. I found an article at "https://moneybinds.com/best-crypto-faucets/". I thoroughly read the article and it was pretty convincing. I just want to get some more opinions whether it is a proven method to earn free cryptocurrencies, and if yes, will it be worth my time and efforts on those platforms?

comments.author: Godday
comments.body: I have read the link  you have provided and I see there it says that there are some crypto faucets that have “can get crypto for free” written in the title. There mentioned several crypto faucets such as Free Cash, Idle Empire, Cointiply, Trust Dice, Roller Coin and Crypto Faucet.I have used some of them and yes, They give you some crypto but its not really free.As you mentioned they gave us several tasks to complete.And if you're asking if it's worth it, I think it's the same as Airdrop, CMIIW.  In my experience it's quite worth it if we like the task they give us. Like Trust Dice and Roller Coin which tells us to play games or Idle Empire which gives us the task of filling out surveys and playing some games there.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I read the article quickly and it seems to be good. I wish you would quote the links of the best faucets and leave the option to the user to click the links. The strange thing is that two of the most popular faucets here are arranged late, so I do not know what was arranged.Finally, although the platform provided a lot of good information, now the faucets are a waste of time, as you can earn a lot if you work hard in that time by developing your skills instead of getting free coins (nothing good is free)so ya you can get some coins using some faucets listed above but you are wasting your time.

comments.author: dwminer1
comments.body: Quote from: cryptosk04 on June 07, 2023, 12:38:12 PMI recently came across a way to get free cryptocurrencies, which is through crypto faucets. I'm not that mature in the crypto world but want to own some crypto and start my journey in this space. After so much research, I got to know that there are many websites called crypto faucets which reward users with crypto for performing several tasks on their platform. I found an article at "https://moneybinds.com/best-crypto-faucets/". I thoroughly read the article and it was pretty convincing. I just want to get some more opinions whether it is a proven method to earn free cryptocurrencies, and if yes, will it be worth my time and efforts on those platforms?It is best to check for yourself whether the remuneration is adequate for you in relation to the time spent. For one person, earning cryptocurrencies worth a few or a dozen or so dollars will be attractive, and for others it will not. The article you linked seems to be a good source. There are several websites presented there, which have been operating for quite a long time and are still solvent.

comments.author: Iyeman
comments.body: There was no worthy faucets that can be tried again. It will be only wasting your time. Your time is worth even more than collecting some tokens that are not even worth with some pennies. That article was not telling you about how to make your time even worthed by collecting it. There is a better way than it. Participating in the bounties are much more reliable at this moment.

comments.author: Jackl87
comments.body: Quote from: cryptosk04 on June 07, 2023, 12:38:12 PMI recently came across a way to get free cryptocurrencies, which is through crypto faucets. I'm not that mature in the crypto world but want to own some crypto and start my journey in this space. After so much research, I got to know that there are many websites called crypto faucets which reward users with crypto for performing several tasks on their platform. In general i would say that faucets are definitely not worth it, at least in my opinion. With most faucets you can usually claim like once per day and every claim is worth only a few cents at max most of the times even only fractions of cents. So you would need to claim from the faucet for probably a few weeks or even months until you have a few dollars on your wallet. If you are coming from a 3rd world country, then this could maybe still be attractive to you, but for the most people i would guess it is just a waste of time.Of course there is also the possibility, that those coins that you get from a faucet will do a x1000 or even more in a few years so those few cents could be a few hundred dollars then, but that chance is slim to none of course.

comments.author: disconnectme
comments.body: Faucets are real and if you have time you can start your crypto journey from there, but the thing about faucets is that you won't get rich from Faucets you might be paid few dollars after spending a lot of time on the sites, I will advise you to go for bounties, bounties is tasking but more rewarding than Faucets and you can do as many as 100 bounties is a month so if you get $10 reward from each that is $1000 per month just do your research before joining many of them now because there are a lot of time wasting and useless bounties. BCT use to be a good place to earn decent amount of money from Bounties before but now it is increasingly becoming difficult to enter, find quality and rewarding bounty.

comments.author: terciduk123
comments.body: Faucet is the simplest way to get Crypto, although sometimes there is a task to do to get crypto for free and quickly. Only the value is very small. It may not correspond to the time you use.To get Crypto without buying, you can join a Bounty campaign or work on tasks at Zealy.

comments.author: Onset
comments.body: Genuine? Some of them. Worth it? Not at all.Faucets used to be a fun thing to do until 2013. Then, after Bitcoin boomed, they became pretty much a waste of time. It probably costs you more to run your computer just to click the Claim button than the amount you receive when you claim it.The time you spend doing faucet claiming can be SO much better spent doing other things. Things like offering services for money and investing it in BTC. Hell, open a lemonade stand and you get more money lol.Also keep in mind many faucets are only temporarily active & existing. Some of them used to allow you to create an account & add up sats until a minimum threshold for withdrawal but the withdrawal never happened because the site closed before anyone could reach it. Worth keeping that in mind.

comments.author: Bitstar_coin
comments.body: Some are genuine because i know a close pal who use to collect a dust of matic and other alts from a site and he was able to use the matic for transaction fees. But the only downside of faucet this days is the amount you will get, unlike before that you get a decent amount, this days you can hardly get anything meaningful. I see it as a waste of time now.

comments.author: cute nmp
comments.body: Most crypto faucets, which offer free cryptocurrencies in exchange for completing certain tasks or solving captchas, are generally not worth the effort. While they may provide a small amount of cryptocurrency, the rewards are usually minuscule and don't justify the time and resources invested. It's more efficient to explore other avenues, such as investing or trading, to accumulate cryptocurrencies.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Quote from: cryptosk04 on June 07, 2023, 12:38:12 PMI just want to get some more opinions whether it is a proven method to earn free cryptocurrencies, and if yes, It is a proven method that you can earn dust amounts for free so if that's the question, then the answer is a yes.Quote from: cryptosk04 on June 07, 2023, 12:38:12 PMwill it be worth my time and efforts on those platforms?For me, it's not worth my time anymore. Faucets are good for newbies just to know that this is possible to earn and they'll have a glance and a way of earning a few of these cryptos. But if you're going to make it as a source of income, you gotta need a lot of spare to collect such decent amount on it.

comments.author: Natalim
comments.body: You'll be asking OP if it was worth it. I would say NO, it is a waste of time and many times I'm doing this, well, I get some but if you are considering your time as precious, you'll never see it was worth enough to spend with. Honestly, it will lose your bright day thinking of it and waiting for nothing. It is very simple, if you use your time wisely, better spend it learning to trade rather than finding faucets and joining airdrop in order to earn free coins. Don't get fool with that promises and convincing words as it was just on the paper, not the real thing to happen.

comments.author: Bolivar_Tony
comments.body: Faucets are good but they wont pay you much rather i think you can engage in doing some bounties, there are different types bounties you can do, like article, if you are good in writing, youtube video, etc, i think the time you will put in doing those faucets when put to doing bounties will pay you more in the end

comments.author: Kavelj22
comments.body: It's not literally free since you have to do small tasks before getting some tokens. These tasks, although they are easy to do, the time you will spend completing them will often be more important and more valuable than the tokens you will get. In other words, it would be better to spend time doing paid work than doing time-wasting tasks.In the past, those faucets were profitable, especially those that gave free satoshis, which became very old after the price of Bitcoin multiplied many times. Unfortunately, this is no longer possible, and most of the faucets give free new currencies that have no value at the present time, and you will have to wait for the currency project to succeed and reach the trading platforms in order to be able to exchange it. It's a real waste of time.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: Quote from: Bolivar_Tony on June 07, 2023, 10:03:11 PMFaucets are good but they wont pay you much rather i think you can engage in doing some bounties, there are different types bounties you can do, like article, if you are good in writing, youtube video, etc, They're more likely an introduction to the ones that you're explaining what crypto or bitcoin is. The same goes with bounties, they won't pay a lot just as the faucets.But if you're patient enough to collect all of those rewards you'll get from both of it, that's your decision which you think is fine or not.Quote from: Bolivar_Tony on June 07, 2023, 10:03:11 PMi think the time you will put in doing those faucets when put to doing bounties will pay you more in the end You're unsure with it as well because not all bounties are paying.

comments.author: AakZaki
comments.body: After opening the link you provided, it seems that there are still many Faucet websites that provide free crypto coins, but of course in very small amounts.Some of the faucet websites on the website include the Gambling website.In my opinion, the best Faucet website is Freebitcoin and this is a website that has been around for quite a while now. Giving Bitcoins for free every hour.

comments.author: Coinbox1
comments.body: Quote from: cryptosk04 on June 07, 2023, 12:38:12 PMI recently came across a way to get free cryptocurrencies, which is through crypto faucets. I'm not that mature in the crypto world but want to own some crypto and start my journey in this space. After so much research, I got to know that there are many websites called crypto faucets which reward users with crypto for performing several tasks on their platform. I found an article at "https://moneybinds.com/best-crypto-faucets/". I thoroughly read the article and it was pretty convincing. I just want to get some more opinions whether it is a proven method to earn free cryptocurrencies, and if yes, will it be worth my time and efforts on those platforms?Yes they are worth it long term. You never know when the market might turn too.There are many crypto casinos who give this out so its up to you.Our crypto casino TrustDice (founded in 2018) gives free crypto too.You can check it out here and other bonuses if you wish.https://trustdice.win/bonusAll the best

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Onset on June 07, 2023, 06:26:56 PMFaucets used to be a fun thing to do until 2013. Then, after Bitcoin boomed, they became pretty much a waste of time. It probably costs you more to run your computer just to click the Claim button than the amount you receive when you claim it.Linking it as price impact is not the right thing, because what happened is that in the past there were no ways to advertise using bitcoin, and the ability to withdraw bitcoin to dollars was a little complicated, you could mine bitcoin with your device and then use it to promote your services, which is free.On the other hand, the second party can use his phone or computer to watch ads for a small profit, and so on. It is the wheel of supply and demand and the available options.Look, signature campaigns are widespread here, especially gambling, because it is difficult to promote these services outside the forum using Bitcoin, and as the forum represents a huge database, once there are alternatives, it will be more difficult to join these campaigns.

comments.author: deals112
comments.body: In fact wasting your precious time to solve Captchas and sitting in front of your computer for these is really not worth it.You ca use some automation Bots at https://topaibots.top to fetch you some real coins without being in front of computer.however it works only on Windows, but can also work in Windows VPS without anyone being logged in
